featured.text: The soil was softer for seeds to sprout.
These trees, in turn, may give rise to more sprouts, and the cycle continues.
These sprouts grow slowly, nourished by the root system of the “mother” tree.
When the main tree dies, the sprouts are then free to grow as full trees, forming a “fairy ring” of trees around the initial tree.
New trees are often produced from sprouts, little baby trees, which form at the base of the trunk.

definition.en_def: To begin to grow; to come out of a seed or bud.
definition.example: The seeds will sprout in a few days if kept in a warm place.
